question.qText: Historians use maps only to show geographic features.

aBtn.aText: True
False

question.qText: Visual information in your textbook is not as important as the information in the text.

aBtn.aText: True
False

question.qText: Which of the following accurately describes the information presented on this map?

aBtn.aText: Most important composers between the 16th and the 18th centuries were from Italy.
The centers of music and new ideas shifted between the 16th and the 18th centuries.

question.qText: Which conclusion is best supported by the information presented on this map?

aBtn.aText: By the 18th century, Germany and Austria featured several important cultural centers.
There were no centers of music in Spain or Russia between the 16th and the 18th centuries.

question.qText: Which of the following accurately describes the information presented on this map?

aBtn.aText: Prussia continued to gain territory during the 1700s.
Austria continued to lose territory during the 1700s.

question.qText: Which conclusion is best supported by the information presented in this map?

aBtn.aText: Prussia and Austria would come into conflict over territorial expansion.
Austria remained the dominant power in central Europe during the 18th century.

question.qText: Which of the following accurately describes the information presented on this map?

aBtn.aText: By this time, the Protestant religions had yet to make a strong impact.
By this time, four major religions were practiced in Europe.

question.qText: Which conclusion is best supported by the information presented in this map?

aBtn.aText: Half of Ireland adopted Anglicanism because the Irish wanted a union with England.
Neither Italy or Spain had a Protestant Reformation because their rulers were devout Catholics who saw no political or economic reason to convert.

question.qText: Which of the following is true, based on this map?

aBtn.aText: The French advanced deep into Russia before turning back.
The Russians forced the French to retreat as soon as they reached the Russian border.

question.qText: Which conclusion is best supported by the information presented in this map?

aBtn.aText: The Russians won the battles of Smolensk and Borodino.
The French won the battles of Drissa and Borodino.
